thread.title: Kansas City Royals-Houston Astros in MLB Playoffs 2015: What TV channel, live updates, live stream
thread.title_full: Kansas City Royals-Houston Astros in MLB Playoffs 2015: What TV channel, live updates, live stream | OregonLive.com

author: JD Humburg | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Kansas City Royals-Houston Astros in MLB Playoffs 2015: What TV channel, live updates, live stream
text:
Game 1 of the American League Division Series between the Kansas City Royals and Houston Astros is underway.
The Royals have homefield after winning the American League central division and finishing with the best record in the AL. The Astros beat the Yankees 3-0 in the AL wild card game Tuesday.
Stay with us throughout the Royals-Astros game for live updates in our running box score, plus analysis in the comments thread. Here are details on how to follow the game.
What: Houston Astros (86-76) at Kansas City Royals (95-67)
Where: Kauffman Stadium, Kansas City
When: Thursday, October 8, at 4:37 p.m. PT/7:37 p.m. ET
What TV channel: TV on Fox Sports 1, radio on KMTT (910 AM) in Portland area
Online live stream: Watch online at Fox Sports Go or listen online at ESPNRadio.com
Season series: Astros won 4-2
Pitching matchup: Kansas City's Yordano Ventura (13-8, 4.08 ERA) vs. Houston's Collin McHugh (19-7, 3.89 ERA)
Playoff schedule: Bookmark our MLB scoreboard for postseason scores and schedules.
Series schedule : (All times PT) Game 1, Thursday, at Kansas City (4:37 p.m.); Game 2, Friday, at Kansas City (12:45 p.m.); Game 3, Sunday, at Houston (1:10 p.m.); x-Game 4, Monday, Oct. 12, at Houston (TBD); x-Game 5, Wednesday, Oct. 14, at Kansas City (TBD). (All games on Fox Sports 1 or MLB Network).
Information from the Associated Press was used in this report.
